name: Solugen
headline: Decarbonizing the chemicals industry.
description: Solugen is decarbonizing the chemistry of everyday life with enzymes and innovative metal catalysts. Our new to the world Bioforge platform technology can produce high value chemical goods that are biobased and carbon negative, at cost on par with current technologies. We are making sustainable chemistry accessible to all living things, to ensure a prosperous world exists for generations.

founders.name: Sean Hunt, Founder/CTO
founders.description:
Sean Hunt is the co-founder and CTO of Solugen, Inc., a renewable chemicals company based in
Houston, TX. All things chemical engineering and process technology development, scaleup, manufacturing, commercialization.

##  Not your typical chemical company 
###  Innovative solutions designed to meet the toughest industrial challenges 
###  Solutions 
## Prioritizing collaboration and speed, we deliver American-made solutions that enhance performance and drive success for the industries shaping our future.
[ ![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Energy_Header-edit0-copy-800x0-c-default.jpg) Oil & Gas  Maximizing productivity and profitability in oilfield operations.  ](https://solugen.com/<https:/solugen.com/oilandgas>) [ ![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Biofuels-Header0-800x0-c-default.jpg) Renewable Fuels  Enhancing feedstock quality, improving yields, and lowering operational costs.  ](https://solugen.com/<https:/solugen.com/renewablefuels>) [ ![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Defense_Header_40-800x0-c-default.jpg) Aerospace & Defense  Strengthening supply chain resilience for mission-critical solutions.  ](https://solugen.com/<https:/solugen.com/aerospace-defense>)
[ View All ](https://solugen.com/</markets>)
### Our Technology
Our Bioforge® platform brings versatility and precision to the manufacturing process, cutting inefficiencies, reducing costs, and delivering unmatched performance tailored to your unique needs. 
The Bioforge Advantage
  * 1Sustainable Feedstocks
  * 2Efficient Processes
  * 3Local Supply Chains


![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/themes/solugen/static/videos/bioforge/png/Solugen_Forge_B03_00001.png)
![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Metal-Catalysis-Cropped.jpg)
Metal Catalysis 
![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Modularity-Cropped-scaled-1.jpg)
Modularity 
![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Engineered-Enzymes-Cropped.png)
Engineered Enzymes 
![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Yield-Cropped.png)
Yield 
![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Metal-Catalysis-Cropped.jpg)
**Metal Catalysis** After the enzyme oxidation reactor, our engineered metal catalysts convert the material into a near final product, with higher selectivity, higher conversion, and lower temperatures than traditional processes. 
Metal Catalysis 
![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Modularity-Cropped-scaled-1.jpg)
**Modularity** The Bioforge can be built anywhere at speed and scale—decentralizing manufacturing and creating safer conditions for both humans and the Earth. 
Modularity 
![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Engineered-Enzymes-Cropped.png)
**Engineered Enzymes** Sustainable feedstocks are fed into our cell-free enzyme oxidation reactor, which begins the highly efficient conversion process with low energy input. 
Engineered Enzymes 
![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Yield-Cropped.png)
**Yield** 1 ton of product is made for every 1 ton of feedstock. The only downstream steps involve an evaporator to remove water and a crystallizer to create a solid final product. 
Yield 
[ ![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/How-It-Works-Cropped-100x100-c-default.png) How It Works ](https://solugen.com/<https:/solugen.com/technology>)
## We’re committed to solving complex challenges by working side by side with our customers to create lasting impact. Together, let’s tackle what’s next.
[ ![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/20240221_102758-2-100x100-c-default.jpg) Partner With Us ](https://solugen.com/<https:/solugen.com/partnerships>)
###  In Good Company 
[ ![](https://solugen.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/Bioforge-Marshall-Blog-1000x0-c-default.jpg) ](https://solugen.com/<https:/solugen.com/solugen-and-adm-announce-strategic-partnership-to-meet-increasing-demand-for-sustainable-products-with-new-biomanufacturing-facility-in-the-u-s-midwest>)

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Solugen**

Founded in 2017 and hailing from Houston, Texas, Solugen is not your typical chemical manufacturer. Their mission? To decarbonize the chemicals industry using innovative enzymes and metal catalysts through their groundbreaking Bioforge® platform. This technology is designed to produce high-value, bio-based chemicals in a way that's not just efficient, but also carbon-negative — essentially making sustainable chemistry accessible across numerous sectors.

**What They Do**

Solugen integrates sustainability into the heart of their operations, targeting multiple industries:

- **Oil & Gas**: Enhancing productivity and profitability in oilfield operations.
- **Renewable Fuels**: Improving feedstock quality and yield while lowering costs.
- **Defense**: Strengthening supply chains for mission-critical solutions.
- **Water Treatment**: Developing carbon-negative products for industrial applications.
- **Cleaning**: Creating more sustainable options for consumer and industrial cleaning needs.
- **Agriculture**: Innovating with eco-friendly agricultural products.
- **Concrete**: Enhancing construction materials for sustainability.
- **Personal Care**: Pioneering sustainable ingredients for personal care products.

**Technology and Innovation**

The Bioforge platform is where the magic happens. It empowers Solugen to produce chemicals with a unique combination of engineered enzymes and advanced metal catalysis. This allows for:

- **High Selectivity and Low Energy Consumption**: Achieving superior yields while minimizing waste.
- **Decentralized Manufacturing**: Flexibility to set up production wherever it's needed, fostering safer and more localized operations.

In essence, for every ton of feedstock, Solugen can generate a ton of product—streamlining the post-production process with straightforward evaporation and crystallization steps to finalize products.

**Team and Leadership**

With a growing team of 200 employees, Solugen is supported by Jared Friedman as a Group Partner from Y Combinator’s Batch W17, marking its status within the thriving tech accelerator community. 

**Conclusion**

Solugen stands at the forefront of climate tech, combining industrial expertise with innovative solutions for a sustainable future. They are committed to tackling complex environmental challenges head-on and invite partnerships and collaborations to further their impact. If you're interested in learning more or getting involved, check out their website at [solugen.com](https://solugen.com).
